title: CVAT Task Specification: Training/Test Mode for Annotation Tasks
description: Project Description: We are seeking a skilled software engineer to implement a new feature in CVAT that allows designating annotation tasks as "Training" or "Test" mode. This feature will provide different permissions to annotators regarding access to quality analytics and ground truth data, enabling more effective training and evaluation of annotators. Problem: Currently, CVAT lacks a mechanism to differentiate between annotation tasks used for training purposes and those used for testing annotator performance. Desired Solution: We require a solution that modifies CVAT to allow designating tasks as "Training" or "Test" with the following functionalities: Task Mode Selection: A new option should be added to the task creation page, allowing the task creator to select the task mode as either "Training" or "Test." This selection can be implemented as a checkbox or a dropdown menu. Annotator Permissions: Training Mode (this is the default setting): Annotators assigned to a "Training" task will have permission to: - View their individual Quality Analytics score. - View conflicts between their annotations and the Ground Truth. - All other permissions and functionalities for the annotator will remain the same as in the standard CVAT workflow. Test Mode: Annotators assigned to a "Test" task will not have permission to: - View their individual Quality Analytics score. - View conflicts between their annotations and the Ground Truth. Ground Truth Visibility: - The Ground Truth data for a task should be completely hidden from annotators in "Test" mode. - The Ground Truth data should be visible to the task creator (supervisor) in both "Training" and "Test" modes. Skills Required: Proficiency in Python and Django (CVAT backend). Experience with PostgreSQL database. Frontend development skills (React). Good understanding of REST APIs. Experience with Git and version control. Deliverables: - Modified CVAT codebase with the implemented solution. - Clear documentation of the changes made.

title: Structural Engineering for Solar Car Parking Installation – 500 kWp System Simulation and Analysis
description: Description: We are seeking an experienced structural engineer to perform a detailed structural analysis and simulation for a 500 kWp solar car parking installation. The project involves the design and evaluation of the structural system that will support solar panels at a specific location while considering high wind speeds, as well as the integration of all relevant components such as foundations, base plates, and J-bolts. Scope of Work: • Project Overview: A 500 kWp solar car parking system • Wind Speed Requirement: The structure must be designed to withstand 56 m/s for 3-second gusts. • Materials: The sections used in the structural design should follow British Standard sections (e.g., Universal Beams, Columns, and Angles). • Simulation Report: The simulation must include the following: o Calculation of reaction forces on the structure due to wind loads and other forces. o Foundation design to support the solar car parking structure. o Base plates and proper specification of J-bolts. o Integration of solar modules: The analysis must incorporate the solar panels' layout, including their wind load effects. • Additional Documents: We will provide the Bill of Materials (BoM) and the solar panel datasheet for reference and accurate integration of components. Deliverables: 1. Simulation Report containing: o Comprehensive analysis of reaction forces at key structural points. o Detailed foundation design and base plate requirements. o J-bolt specifications. o Integration details of solar modules and their interaction with the overall structure. 2. Structural Drawings (if applicable), including layouts and design calculations based on the simulation results. 3. Any additional design recommendations for enhancing the safety and stability of the solar car parking structure under the specified wind conditions. Required Skills: • Expertise in structural engineering and simulation for high-wind environments. • Familiarity with British Standard sections for structural materials. • Experience in designing solar parking structures, including solar carports. • Proficiency in generating structural reports and providing detailed design calculations. • Experience with ANSYS, SAP2000, or similar structural simulation software. Preferred Qualifications: • Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Civil/Structural Engineering. • Specific experience with solar car parking systems or solar infrastructure. • Familiarity with wind load analysis and solar panel integration into parking structures. Timeline: • The project is expected to be completed within 2 days from the start date.

title: Custom Data Table to Embed on WP page
description: I'm looking for a Data Table expert to build out a Salary Data table for Nursing Salaries. Features we will implement: -Collapsible Row (see here for example https://www.levels.fyi/t/software-engineer?countryId=254&country=254 and see mockup table below) -Custom CSS to match styling above below examples -Multiple Filters (filter by city, specialty, Years Experience, company, hospital type) -Search bar above table where user can type a company/city/specialty and the appropriate facilities appear -Pagination -Sort row from Highest Number to Lowest -Mobile Responsive -There are empty fields in my CSV. Ideally empty rows are hidden. -No page refresh with filter selection -Hide cells that are empty from displaying on frontend (in collapsible row) Styling and functionality I am shooting for: https://www.levels.fyi/t/software-engineer?countryId=254&country=254 and see mockup table below Mockup table: We will need to display the fields listed in my mockup. This mockup is also a table design we should shoot for. These fields in this table match the column in my sample data. https://figma.com/design/xezq8KptGoXAg5chYfQsiP/RN-Data-Table?node-id=0-1&p=f&t=pMc56ehYGzMccXTg-0 All data from this table comes from a CSV file I export from this form: https://form.fillout.com/t/fpXbEuU9Wmus. We don't need automatic syncing between CSV and the DB. I can upload it manually. Please respond with 1) any questions 2) estimated cost 3) estimated time to complete 4) when you can start Looking to move forward ASAP

title: Customize wpDataTables
description: I'm looking for a wpDataTables expert to build out a Salary Data table for Nursing Salary. Features we will implement: -Collapsible Row (https://wpdatatables.com/table-with-collapsible-rows/?utm_source=wpdt-lite&utm_medium=lite-upgrade&utm_campaign=wpdt&utm_content=wpdt) -Custom CSS to match styling -Multiple Filters (filter by city, specialty, Years Experience, company, hospital type) -Search bar above table where user can type a company/city/specialty and the appropriate facilities appear -Pagination -Sort row from Highest Number to Lowest -Mobile Responsive -Hide cells that are empty from displaying on frontend (in collapsible row) Styling I am shooting for: https://www.levels.fyi/t/software-engineer?countryId=254&country=254 and see mockup table below Mockup table: We will need to display the fields listed in my mockup. title: Structural engineer / architectural plans / MEP / 3D rendering
description: I've created a table outlining a proposed schedule for your 20,000 square foot warehouse project in Lake City, GA. This timeline aims to accomplish all tasks within 90 days, including structural engineering, architectural plans, MEP (Mechanical, Electrical, and Plumbing) design, and 3D rendering. Phase Task Duration Due Date Payment Schedule 1 Project Kickoff & Initial Consultation 3 days Day 3 10% of total fee 2 Conceptual Design & Schematic Layout 10 days Day 13 15% of total fee 3 Structural Engineering Analysis 14 days Day 27 20% of total fee 4 Architectural Plans Development 21 days Day 48 20% of total fee 5 MEP Design 14 days Day 62 15% of total fee 6 3D Rendering 14 days Day 76 10% of total fee 7 Final Review and Revisions 7 days Day 83 5% of total fee 8 Project Completion & Deliverables 7 days Day 90 5% of total fee Please note that this timeline is ambitious and may need to be adjusted based on the structural engineer's workload and the complexity of the project13. The payment schedule is structured to align with key milestones and deliverables throughout the project. Some key considerations for the structural engineer: The timeline allows for overlap between some phases to maximize efficiency. The structural engineering analysis is given priority to ensure a solid foundation for subsequent design work. 3D rendering is scheduled towards the end of the project when most design elements are finalized4. A final review period is included to address any necessary revisions or adjustments. When presenting this proposal to the structural engineer, emphasize that you're open to discussing adjustments to the timeline if needed, while still aiming to complete the project within the 90-day timeframe. Additionally, be prepared to provide any specific requirements or constraints for the warehouse that might impact the design process Must be licensed in the State of Georgia.

title: Mechanical Engineer for Dental Implant System Design with Excellent Professional Design Capabilities
description: I am a licensed dentist with extensive experience in implantology and have developed a novel dental implant system for retaining removable prosthetic devices. I am seeking a highly skilled and professional mechanical engineer with extensive experience in SolidWorks or ANSYS to bring my designs to life and ensure they meet the highest standards of precision and functionality. An NDA is required before discussing this project. Key Responsibilities: • Collaborate to refine and develop existing designs for a dental implant system. • Utilize SolidWorks or similar software to create detailed 3D CAD models. • Conduct finite element analysis (FEA) using SolidWorks and/or ANSYS or equivalent tools to evaluate and optimize designs. • Work with reputable FEA engineers as needed to ensure accuracy and reliability in simulations. • Provide feedback and suggestions to improve design durability, efficiency, and manufacturability. • Maintain a professional approach to timelines and deliverables, ensuring projects are completed on time and with meticulous attention to detail. Requirements: • Proven experience in mechanical design, preferably in the medical or dental device industry. • Mastery of SolidWorks, ANSYS, or equivalent CAD and FEA software. • Strong understanding of engineering principles, particularly in materials and stress analysis. • Ability to communicate effectively, ask insightful questions, and incorporate feedback. • A commitment to professionalism, attention to detail, and delivering high-quality work. Preferred Qualifications: • Previous experience with dental implant or prosthetic device design. • Access to and collaboration with reputable FEA engineers. • Familiarity with regulatory considerations in medical device design. What I Offer: This is an exciting opportunity to contribute to an innovative dental implant system. You will work closely with a dedicated professional and have the chance to be part of a project that prioritizes quality and ingenuity. If you meet the above qualifications and are eager to take on this challenging and rewarding project, please submit your proposal, including a portfolio of relevant work. Let’s work together to create something extraordinary!

title: Reverse Engineer – Chromium-Based Desktop Application (Discovery Phase)
description: We are looking for a skilled Reverse Engineer to analyze the internal workings of a complex Chromium-based desktop application used for content acquisition. This initial phase focuses on thorough documentation of the application’s architecture, including its approaches to audio/video handling and any encryption or DRM (Digital Rights Management) mechanisms. Your findings will help us assess feasibility, complexity, and the scope of a potential second-phase project aimed at recreating some or all of the application’s functionality. Key Responsibilities (Phase 1 – Discovery): • Conduct a detailed analysis of a Chromium-based application, including its use of Electron, Mantle, ReactiveObjC, Squirrel, WebDevine, GPU rendering, and other frameworks. • Investigate how the application handles audio and video streams, including potential DRM, encryption, or decryption steps. • Map out the data flows, architectural patterns, and system components critical for content acquisition. • Produce comprehensive documentation detailing system architecture, component interactions, update mechanisms, and integration points for handling protected content. Potential Future Phase (Replication): • Depending on the complexity and feasibility revealed by the discovery phase, a subsequent project may involve recreating or replicating the application’s functionality. This might include designing new workflows for handling encrypted content, integrating audio/video pipelines, and ensuring that the platform can scale and remain secure. Qualifications: • Proven experience in reverse engineering complex software applications, preferably those built on Chromium or Electron frameworks. • Familiarity with audio/video stream handling, including codecs, DRM schemes, and potential decryption techniques. • Strong understanding of low-level analysis techniques such as binary analysis, debugging, and decompilation. • Proficiency in Objective-C, C++, JavaScript, or other languages relevant to Electron and related frameworks. • Knowledge of GPU acceleration, advanced rendering pipelines, and update mechanisms like Squirrel. • Excellent documentation skills and attention to detail.

title: Full Stack Websites and Automations Engineer (Must have experience with the Monday.com API)
description: About Valiant: ‎ ‎ Valiant is a full-service content creation and digital marketing agency for service businesses in the trading, reselling, sports betting, and e-commerce niches. Our clients include some of the largest companies in the online side-hustle niche including Whop.com, one of the largest digital marketplace in the world. Our current offerings include short-form video creation, email marketing, and paid advertising, among others. Over the next 12 months we have plans to expand and as a result are looking to hire additional marketing staff in our paid ads, social media, and email marketing teams. Our vision is to be the go-to marketing agency for all types of services that help people make money online. We are already very well known in the sports betting and reselling niches however are looking to venture much further into niches we’re less known in and build a market-wide reputation for ruthlessly outperforming other marketers in the space. Compensation & Perks: 💸 $4,000 to $6,000 in monthly starting salary. 📈 Up to $8k in monthly salary based on initial 90-day performance. 🌎 Full-time remote-based position with flexible working hours. ✈️ Flights, US visa sponsorship, and accommodation for team meetups. Job Responsibilities: – Automate our company operations and work with the Monday.com API – Implementing and optimizing pre-made website designs on WordPress, Webflow, or Framer. – Writing scripts to scrape websites for potential future sales leads. – Leading and advising our website designer and setting a good example in and outside of work. – Maintaining existing Discord bots and existing websites made on WordPress. Required Qualifications: – Experienced with the Monday.com API, Zapier and Make.com – 1 or more years of experience as a software engineer. – Willing to commit to working full-time exclusively for our company (cannot be in school, running your own business, or working other jobs). – Experience with the following technologies: HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. – Preferably experience with Wordpress, Webflow or Framer, or other CMS. - Ability to make scripts and automation that can scrape websites for data. – Capable of turning website mock-ups and designs into code. – Capable of making websites responsive and mobile optimized. Preferred Qualifications: – Experience with integrating 3rd party APIs (Stripe API, etc) – Experience with Material UI / Material Design. – Experience with UI/UX design tools such as Figma and Adobe. – Previous experience starting a business or experience working at smaller companies/startups. – Bachelors or Masters in computer science, computer engineering, electrical engineering, or equivalent experience. – Knowledge, or interest in sports betting, trading, reselling, online selling, or e-commerce. Who We Need: – You’ve got positive energy. You’re optimistic about the future and determined to get there. – You are looking for an exciting opportunity that isn’t just about the money. – You’re comfortable with agile workflow and are quick to iterate. – You work well with direct, rapid, and candid feedback. – You’re both an active communicator and an eager listener. – You’re passionate about software development and have high standards for your code. – You are willing to take 100% responsibility for your code. – You’re willing to go outside of your comfort zone and you’re up for new challenges. – You are a very hard-working and driven person, and are flexible with your work days/hours. – You have a winners mindset. You want to win and you’re not satisfied with the status quo. – You are comfortable with startup culture. It’s casual, and not corporate, but is demanding.

title: Lead Engineer
description: If interested, send your proposal along with your resume. Job Title: Lead Engineer Department: Engineering Our company exists to provide ease, access, and connection to become the central hub for exceptional experiences. Our mission is to create a frictionless nightlife and entertainment experience for venues and patrons through simple, user-focused technology. We are looking for a Lead Engineer interested in building and leading the front-end development of our platform, delivering seamless, responsive, and high-performance user interfaces on both the iOS and Android platforms. You will be responsible for designing and planning these applications, as well as coordinating with the teams responsible for other layers of the product infrastructure. Building a product is a highly collaborative effort, and as such, a strong team player with a commitment to perfection is required. Responsibilities: ● Lead Front-End Development: Take ownership of the entire front-end development process, ensuring high-quality code, performance optimization, and maintainability. ● Architecture and Design: Design and implement efficient, scalable, and modular front-end architecture for a SaaS platform using modern technologies ● Collaboration: Work closely with product managers, UX/UI designers, and back-end developers to deliver features from concept to deployment and ensure smooth integration with back-end services and leverage native APIs with both platforms. ● Mentorship: Guide and mentor junior front-end developers, conducting code reviews and sharing best practices. ● Performance Optimization: Ensure the platform is responsive and performant across all devices and browsers. ● Testing and Debugging: Write automated tests and maintain code, and ensure the front-end components are reliable and bug-free. Diagnose and fix bugs while eliminating performance bottlenecks. ● Maintain and build new features for our React Native application. ● Continuous Improvement: Stay up to date with the latest front-end development trends, frameworks, and best practices, and introduce innovative solutions to improve the product - Reach out to the open source community to encourage and help implement mission-critical software fixes—React Native moves fast and often breaks things. ● Design and/or implement UI/UX team designs into existing application ● Develop with a security first mentality following the OWASP Top 10 and PCI-DSS compliance ● Agile Methodology: Participate in Agile development practices including daily standups, sprint planning, and retrospectives. Skills ● Proficiency in JavaScript and TypeScript language and its nuances, including ES6+ syntax, and modern front-end frameworks. ● Expert in React.js (preferred) for building interactive UIs and component-based architectures. ● UI/UX: Understanding of responsive design principles, CSS frameworks like TailwindCSS or Bootstrap, and experience with design tools like Figma, Sketch, or Adobe XD. ● RESTful APIs & GraphQL: Strong knowledge of integrating front-end applications with RESTful APIs and GraphQL services. ● Knowledge of object-oriented programming ● Ability to write well-documented, clean Javascript/Typescript code ● Rock solid at working with third-party dependencies and debugging dependency conflicts ● Familiarity with native build tools, like XCode, Gradle Android Studio ● Understanding of REST APIs, the document request model, and offline storage ● Experience with automated/unit testing suites, like React Native Testing Library, Jest, Mocha, WebdriverIO, Appium, Jasmine ● Experience with Jenkins, Figma, JIRA, Github, Static Code analyzers like MOBSF ● Agile/Scrum: Familiarity with Agile development processes and tools like JIRA or Trello. Education and/or Experience ● Bachelor's degree in computer science, information technology, computer engineering, or a related field ● 5+ years of professional experience as a Front-End Developer, with at least 2+ years in a lead or senior role A payment of $3K USD per month will be paid to the Lead Engineer.

title: Full-Stack Software Engineer for AI-Powered Document Solutions
description: As a Full-Stack Software Engineer at Nootate, you will take our MVP and turn it into a fully functional production web application. Working from a completed Figma design of the final product, you’ll focus on creating a seamless user experience and implementing core features. You’ll help define a detailed roadmap, establish milestones, and execute a step-by-step development plan. Your key responsibilities include: • Roadmap & Planning: Collaborate with the founder to develop a technical roadmap and break down work into milestones and dates Feature Development: • Integrate multiple AI providers for responses. • Enhance parsing capabilities, potentially leveraging third-party services like Zerox/OmniAI. • Implement logging features to improve PDF document structure and prompt performance, with potential export capabilities for users’ notes. • Develop AI-assisted document features, such as highlighting tools and dynamic annotations Database Development: • Set up and optimize SQL user databases and schemas. • Implement a Vector Pinecone database with schema, API, and front-end integration. PDF-Specific Features: • Develop and refine features like toolbar tools (zoom, pointer, search, etc.). • Enable efficient AI-assisted document search. Admin Panel & Dashboard: • Develop and connect admin tools to monitor and manage user activities. • Create a polished documents dashboard for easy access and management. UI/UX Implementation: • Build workflows, landing pages, and overall layouts based on Figma designs. • Optimize sidebars, layouts, and interface polish to ensure a seamless experience. You will work closely with the founder and have check-in meetings with senior advisors.
